content.description:
Directions:

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> for which <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> is a real number. Angle measures for trigonometric functions are assumed to be in radians.

Solutions to equations must be real numbers. Determine the exact value of any expression that can be obtained without a calculator. For example, <math alttext="log subscript 2 8"><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mn>8</mn></math>, <math alttext="cos open parentheses pi over 2 close parentheses"><mi>cos</mi><mfenced><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mfenced></math>, and <math alttext="inverse sine 1"><msup><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mfenced><mn>1</mn></mfenced></math> can be evaluated without a calculator.

Unless otherwise specified, combine terms using algebraic methods and rules for exponents and logarithms, where applicable. For example, <math alttext="2 x plus 3 x"><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi></math>, <math alttext="5 squared times 5 cubed"><msup><mn>5</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>5</mn><mn>3</mn></msup></math>, <math alttext="x to the power of 5 over x squared"><mfrac><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>5</mn></msup><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>, and <math alttext="ln 3 plus ln 5"><mi>ln</mi><mpadded lspace="-1px"><mn>3</mn></mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>ln</mi><mpadded lspace="-1px"><mn>5</mn></mpadded></math> should be rewritten in equivalent forms.

For each part of the question, show the work that leads to your answers.
content.question:
Part A

The functions <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> and <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> are given by

<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 15 arcsin x"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn><mi>arcsin</mi><mi>x</mi></math>

<math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 10 open parentheses 1 minus x close parentheses minus log subscript 10 4"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mn>4</mn></math>.

(i) Solve <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 5 pi"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math>.

(ii) Solve <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals 1"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math>.

frqParts.text:
Part A

The functions <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> and <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> are given by

<math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 15 arcsin x"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn><mi>arcsin</mi><mi>x</mi></math>

<math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 10 open parentheses 1 minus x close parentheses minus log subscript 10 4"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>-</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mn>4</mn></math>.

(i) Solve <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 5 pi"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math>.

(ii) Solve <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals 1"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> for values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> in the domain of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math>.

Part B

The functions <math alttext="j"><mi>j</mi></math> and <math alttext="k"><mi>k</mi></math> are given by

<math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses equals log subscript 2 open parentheses x plus 4 close parentheses minus 11 log subscript 2 open parentheses x minus 2 close parentheses plus log subscript 2 open parentheses x cubed close parentheses"><mi>j</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>-</mo><mn>11</mn><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfenced><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses cot x close parentheses open parentheses csc x close parentheses"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>cot</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mrow><mi>csc</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>.

(i) Rewrite <math alttext="j open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>j</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as a single logarithm base <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math> without negative exponents in any part of the expression. Your result should be of the form <math alttext="log subscript 2 open parentheses text expression end text close parentheses"><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mfenced><mtext>expression</mtext></mfenced></math>.

(ii) Rewrite <math alttext="k open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> as a fraction involving powers of <math alttext="cos x"><mi>cos</mi><mi>x</mi></math> and no other trigonometric functions.

Part C

The function <math alttext="m"><mi>m</mi></math> is given by

<math alttext="m open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses 2 to the power of x close parentheses squared minus 3 times 2 to the power of x"><mi>m</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><msup><mfenced><msup><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></msup></mfenced><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>·</mo><msup><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></msup></math>.

Find all input values in the domain of <math alttext="m"><mi>m</mi></math> that yield an output value of <math alttext="18"><mn>18</mn></math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
